intro: Hieracium curvidens, commonly known as the curvedleaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinctive wavy or curled margin, giving it its common name. The flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
